revised_title: Circular Polarization and Its Discovery in Various Crystals
tldr: The author discusses the discovery of circular polarization in various crystals, such as quartz, chlorate of soda, and cinnabar. These discoveries have important implications for geologists and the study of light and heat. The author also mentions the research conducted by M. Des Cloizeaux, who explored the crystallization and internal construction of quartz and made observations in Iceland.
